intro: Fleurya cuneata var. subintegra, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and China. Fleurya cuneata var. subintegra is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and unique foliage.
